data.title: JSDoc comment no longer picks up method arguments -onEnter keybinding condition must honour additional text, command, and snippet type
data.body:
From #25959 

**Repo**
- Create a completion item provider that returns a completion item with the insert text `abc` and a command that edits the document at the completion position
- Trigger the completion item by typing `abc` in a document

**Bug**
Even though the insert text will not change the document, the command will. Because VSCode thinks the item will not change the current document, we do not capture `enter` which results in an extra new line being inserted into the document

**Fix**
Treat any completion item with a command as `MakesTextEdit`

data.title: output channel confuse location when there are multiple vscode window

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open two vscode window

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3126745/25736004/dd77c074-31a1-11e7-9abc-5e0ab8524ae1.png)

2. In one vscode window (such as `cc`) , call a command which will create an output channel when click confirm button

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3126745/25736074/3408c974-31a2-11e7-91ca-1d33c6907708.png)

3. As I expected, this output channel will show in current vscode window, but it showed in another window which opened project `aop`

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3126745/25736314/a08772a2-31a3-11e7-9c7c-30713674964c.png)
This is my code, it will be called through RPC when user do some operation in electron GUI

```javascript
seekAdd(params) {
  const output = vscode.window.createOutputChannel('seek');
  output.show();
  output.appendLine('\n开始添加模板...');
  ...   
},
```

What should I do if I want the output channel show in vscode window which call that command ?

data.title: VSCode typechecking mars react syntax as invalid
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 2.3.2
- OS Version: MacOS X 10.11.6

In the new version, with typechecking for js files enabled `"javascript.implicitProjectConfig.checkJs": true` react syntax throws errors:

1. `style` argument is marked as invalid on div elements:

```
Type '{ style: { [x: string]: any; display: string; flexDirection: string; }; }' is not assignable to type 'HTMLProps<HTMLDivElement>'.
  Types of property 'style' are incompatible.
    Type '{ [x: string]: any; display: string; flexDirection: string; }' is not assignable to type 'CSSProperties'.
      Types of property 'flexDirection' are incompatible.
        Type 'string' is not assignable to type '"column" | "initial" | "inherit" | "unset" | "row" | "row-reverse" | "column-reverse"'.
```

2. `Component.propTypes` is marked as invalid:

```
[js] Property 'propTypes' does not exist on type '(props: any) => Element'.
```

data.title: Separate workbench theme and syntax theme

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
After upgrading to VS Code 1.12, I noticed that the workbench theme of the built-in **Monokai** color theme had been changed. However, I preferred the default workbench theme a lot.

But in VS Code, there are only two types of themes: **Color Theme** and **Icon Theme**, and the workbench theme is tightly coupled with the syntax theme in the Color Theme category.

In contrast, Sublime Text separates theme into `color_scheme` and `theme` in the preferences. For example, I can choose Material style for the workbench and Monokai for the syntax highlighting. Does the team have plan to separate them and let users have more flexibility to customize their editor?

By the way, I found that some of theme extensions use `.json` as their theme file (including the built-in [Monokai](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/extensions/theme-monokai/themes/monokai-color-theme.json)), but the official documentation only mentions that we can use `yo code` to generate theme extension with an existing `.tmTheme` file. Is there any documentation for clarifying their difference and also the schema of the `.json` file?

data.title: Markdown Preview - Undocumented change?
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->
**NOTE:** I don't know about other file types, as I only preview Markdown files.

- VSCode Version: 1.12.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Home x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a markdown file to edit
2. Click on the preview button

**Before the 1.12 update**
Clicking on the preview button would open the preview in a new tab in the same group as the editor tab.

**After the 1.12 update**
The preview button icon is different and when clicked, splits the editor and opens the preview in a new tab (`to the side`  as it says in the tooltip) in the new group.

**Request**
If possible, can you please add an option (a new setting called `"markdown.previewInNewGroup" = false` maybe?) to restore the previous behaviour if desired.

data.title: Launching speed (not an issue but a kind note)
data.body:
First of all, I really love this editor so thanks very much for contributing to VSCode
I noticed that VSCode is getting slower than half a year ago. Every time I launch it, it takes about 2 sec. I know it is not "slow" comparing to an IDE, but I am worried that VSCode might take even longer in the future, as more and more features are being added to it.

Maybe some rearrangement can be made? like, some features could be loaded after the text is displayed.

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Close VSCode's extensions (in terminal) and launch VSCode
2. Count time

data.title: The latest version of the custom code snippet does not work~
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.1 (f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b, 2017-05-04T21:26:50.689Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
The latest version of the custom code snippet does not work~

```
"ajax to jquery": {
  "prefix": "ajaxj",
  "body": [
    "$.ajax({",
    "	type: '$1',",
    "	url: '$2',",
    "	data: '',",
    "	dataType: 'json',",
    "	beforeSend: function() {",
    "	}",
    "})",
    ".done(function(res) {",
    "	if('ok' === res.ret && res.data.success) {",
    "	}else{",
    "	}",
    "});"
  ],
  "description": "ajax to jquery"
}
```

ajaxj =>
```
  $.ajax({
  
  ,
  
  ,
  
  ,
  
  ,
  
  .done(function(res) {
  
  [object Object]
  [object Object]
  ,
  });
```
